member.name: T:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDeviceFlags
member.summary:
Common Arm device flags (actually only for test).
Actually we have not defined special configuration arm options yet, but there are defined some options for testing the configuration property grid.

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDeviceFlags.NoArmFlag
member.summary: no flag variable (not Browsable)

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDeviceFlags.AllowRelaxedItemMove
member.summary: Relaxed Item move flag

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDeviceFlags.AllowRelaxedWashMove
member.summary: Allow relaxed wash station move

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDeviceFlags.AutoLimitLockRange
member.summary: Limit the locked arm range to destination after X movements

member.name: T:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice
member.summary:
Arm device.
The arm device implements the basic needs of arms. It holds a X motor and a collection of connected Y/Z devices. In addition it has some common option flags which are mostly not used yet.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_Robot
In general all sias arms are derivated from SArmDevice. The implemented X motor is a sias CAN module motor (\b see \nlink{Sias::Motor,SMotorDevice}. The Y/Z devices are based on sias Y/Z devices (\b see SYZDevice}.
%SArmDevice class diagram
\image html "SArmDevice.png"

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.NoMoveValue
member.summary: internal value for Xmotor not required to move

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.GetArmEviroment
member.summary: Get Arm environment. This method collects the environment of the arm: - Get the robot from the parent member - Get the list of arms of the robot - Create a x position collection for all arms

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice._Flags
member.summary: General arm device flags variable

member.summary: X motor init offset field

member.summary: Y motor init offset field

member.summary: Default constructor. This constructor creates a device with all configuration members to their default values.

member.summary: XML string configuration constructor. This constructor creates a device by parsing the device parameters from the given XML configuration string.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.Finalize
member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the SArmDevice is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice._NoTravelMove
member.summary: No travel move flag

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice._MinTravelHeight
member.summary: Minimum travel height field

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice._OldPriority
member.summary: Priority backup array field

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.ArmLockBackup
member.summary:
Backup arm lock (Priority).
This should be called before usage of any routine locking the arm. - PrepMoveWithLock(...) - PrepXMove(...) - LockArmRange(...) - MoveWithArmRangeLock(...), used also in - MoveXY(...) - MoveXYRange(...) - MoveYZDeviceToXY(...) . After the arm is no longer needed to be locked, ArmLockRestore() should be called.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.ArmLockRestore
member.summary:
Restore arm lock (Priority).
See ArmLockBackup() for details.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.InitRequired(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary: Check if the arms default execution group is selected at the given init options,
member.returns: True if we have to init, false if not

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary:
Init Arm.
Initialization sequence: \n - move all Z motors up - move X motor to its init offset - init Y motors (motor by motor) - init X motor
member.param: This should allow init only parts, but is not supported yet. To keep applications compatible with older versions it is recommended to pass 0xFFFFFFFF for the init options. This forces an Initialization of the complete arm.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.PrepareTravelMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare travel move. This method prepares travel moves for all Y/Z devices of the arm. It returns the execution group(s) of all prepared modules, but it does not start the movement. This allows to move up all axis at the same time.
member.param: The Travel height in worktable coordinates
member.returns: the execution group of all prepared devices

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.PrepareTravelMove(System.Double,System.Double[])
member.summary:
Prepare travel move.
This method prepares travel moves for all Y/Z devices of the arm. It returns the execution group(s) of all prepared modules, but it does not start the movement. This allows to move up all axis at the same time.
member.param: New X position (for calculating the travel height)
New Y positions (for calculating the travel height)
member.returns: Execution group of all prepared modules

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.PrepareTravelMove(System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare travel move. This method prepares a travel move to a new X position. when not moving the Y motors. This method creates a Y position array of the current positions and then calls PrepareTravelMove(XPos, YPosArr).
member.param: New X position (for calculating the travel height)
member.returns: Execution group of all prepared modules

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.MoveToZTravel(System.Double)
member.summary:
Move to given travel height.
The Z motors will only move if the height is lower then the expected travel height axis with higher positions will not move.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.NeedToWaitForArm(Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check if arm move is required/allowed This method checks if the defined arm is required and allowed to move away.
member.param: True if the arm requires to move to avoid crash
True if we would touch the arms locked range
member.returns: true if we have to wait for this arm otherwise false.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.iPrepMoves(Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.SArmEnviroment@,System.Double,System.Double[],System.Byte)
member.summary: This method prepares the X/Y-move calculated by a previous iLockArmRange(). It executes the needed travel moves and

members.member:
Move arm with arm range locking.
This method locks a defined X section for a given arm. Then it moves to the defined position. If other arms will be inside of the defined X area the priority defines which arm(s) keep access. If the actual arm is allowed to move, it gets a locked priority and moves the other arms away.
Arm destination position Y-Positions form movement Start of X area End of X area True if movement is done and the arm range is locked TODO: optimize movements in case of no X/Y movement is needed

Prepared X move
This method prepares a X arm movement. If the movement is allowed, it locks the needed move range. Optionally it prepares the needed movements for other arms including the needed travel moves.
X position to move to X motor move speed (0 for default speed) X motor move ramp (0 for default ramp) The execution group of all prepared modules TODO: optimize movements in case of no X movement is needed

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.LockArmRange(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This method will only lock the specified arm range, but does not move the arm.
member.returns: True

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.MoveXY(System.Double,System.Double[])
member.summary: This method moves the arm to the given positions. Therefore it checks other arms for collisions and locks the arm for accessing.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.MoveXY(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This method moves the arm to the given positions. Therefore it checks other arms for collisions and locks the arm for accessing.
member.param: First Y position to move to
Y distance for other Y devices

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.MoveYZDeviceToXY(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This method moves one Y/Z device to the given positions. It takes care that all other Y/Z devices move to positions not disturbing the movement. In addition it takes care to avoid collisions with other (known) arms.
member.param: First Y position to move to

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.MoveXYRange(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary:
Move tips anywhere in the defined range.
This method moves the arm to the given positions. Therefore it checks other arms for collisions and locks the arm for accessing. In difference to the "normal" MoveXY it moves to anywhere in the given area.
member.param: Minimum positions of the Y ranges
Maximum positions of the Y ranges

member.summary: Y/Z device array as SYZDevice[]

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.ExecutionGroup
member.summary: Execution group property. This property can be used to get/set the execution group of all sub devices of the Arm. Setting the execution group results in the same execution group for all sub devices. Getting it results in a binary of all sub device execution groups.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.XWorktablePosition
member.summary: Last known arm X desk position.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.XWorktablePosFromDevice
member.summary: Request current arm X desk position.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.YDskMin
member.summary:
Actual minimum used Y position of the arm
The minimum Y position is the Y position of the first Y/Z device of the arm.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.YDskMax
member.summary:
Actual maximum used Y position of the arm
The maximum Y position is the Y position of the last Y/Z device of the arm.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.TravelSafetyMarginYMin
member.summary:
Travel safety margin YMin.
This safety margin defines the additional Y offset at the first Y/Z device.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.TravelSafetyMarginYMax
member.summary:
Travel safety margin YMax.
This safety margin defines the additional Y offset at the last Y/Z device.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.TravelSafetyMarginX
member.summary:
Travel safety margin X.
This safety margin defines the additional X offset needed to avoid a crash.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.NoTravelMove
member.summary: No travel move flag. This flag is used to force a movement without moving the Z motor to a save height. \b WARNING: Take care setting this flag to true may damage the device, if not used under well known conditions !!

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmDevice.MinTravelHeight
member.summary:
Minimum travel height
This property may be used to define a minimum for the travel height. In case the travel height coming from layout is below the defined height the minimum travel height is used instead.

Arm environment class.
The arm environment class keeps information about the environment where the arm is integrated. It is sued by the collision detection routines.

members.member:
General Y/Z device
The Y/Z device is typically part of an \ref SArmDevice . It includes at least a Y and a Z motor.
\ingroup Dev_Robot
In general all sias Y/Z devices are derivated from SYZDevice. The implemented Y and Z motors are sias CAN module motors (/b see \nlink{Sias::Motor,SMotorDevice}
%SYZDevice class diagram
\image html "SYZDevice.png"

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice._TravelSafetyMargin
member.summary: Travel safety margin variable.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. This constructor creates a device with all configuration members to its their default values.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: XML string configuration constructor. This constructor creates a device by parsing the device parameters from the given XML configuration string.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.#ctor(Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice,System.Double,System.Int32,Sias.Motor.SMotorDevice,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Manual generation constructor. This constructor creates a device by using the given parameters.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.InitRequired(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary: Check if the default execution group gives an init request with the given init options.
member.returns: True if we have to init, false if not

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary:
Init Y/Z device.
Initialization sequence: \n - init Z motor (this move it up) - init Y motors
member.param: This should allow the Initialization only parts, but is not supported yet. To keep applications compatible with older versions it is recommended to pass 0xFFFFFFFF for the init options. This forces an Initialization of the complete arm.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.PrepareYMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Y motor move to an absolute worktable position. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.PrepareRelativeYMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare relative Y motor move. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.
member.param: Relative Y position in worktable coordinates [mm]

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.CheckZRange(System.Double)
member.summary: This method checks and optionally limits the Z range without giving an error. In case of changing the position a warning is logged.
member.returns: Optionally limited absolute destination worktable position

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.PrepareTravelMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor travel move if necessary. This method makes sure, that the Z motor moves at least to the defined travel height. If the Z motor is above the defined travel height it will not move.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.PrepareZMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor move to an absolute worktable position. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.PrepareRelativeZMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare relative Z motor move. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.
member.param: Relative Z position in worktable coordinates [mm]

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.PrepareZScanMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor scan move to an absolute worktable position. The scan move gets the submerge way after detection. As we have no way to have an acceleration on addition this will always use the modules default acceleration! Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.PrepareZBlockMove(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor block move to an absolute worktable position. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.
member.param: Block mode, this defines the moving force. In a normal configured system that means 1=strong, 2=middle, 3=weak

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.SetLDSensitivity(System.Byte)
member.summary: Set liquid detector sensitivity mode. The standard liquid detection systems have 4 different sensitivities. - 1 - sensitivity for fixed tips in tubes - 2 - sensitivity for fixed tips in MTPs - 3 - sensitivity for disposable tips in tubes - 4 - sensitivity for disposable tips in MTPs . Of course this sensitivities modes may be different on non standard robots.
member.returns: True if the new sensitivity mode was accepted

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.DefaultExecutionGroup
member.summary: Default execution group for the Y/Z device property

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.YMax
member.summary: Maximum Y motor move range [mm].

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.ZMax
member.summary: Maximum Z motor move range [mm].

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.YMotor
member.summary: Y Motor.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.ZMotor
member.summary: Z Motor.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.TravelSafetyMargin
member.summary:
Safety margin for travel calculations.
This property defines a safety margin for the Y/Z device. This safety margin is a circle around the middle of the Y/Z device which can be covered by the Y/Z device. It is used to calculate an extended move rectangle for calculating the travel height.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.ExecutionGroup
member.summary:
Execution group property.
This property can be used to get/set the execution group of all sub devices of the Arm. Setting the execution group results in the same execution group for all sub devices. Getting it will result in a binary of all sub device execution groups.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.YWorktablePosition
member.summary:
Y worktable position from device.
This property returns the last known Y motor position as worktable coordinates.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.YWorktablePositionFromDevice
member.summary:
Z worktable position from device.
This property requests the current motor position from the Z motor device and translates it to worktable coordinates.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.ZWorktablePosition
member.summary:
Z Worktable position from device.
This property returns the last known Z motor position as worktable coordinates.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDevice.ZWorktablePositionFromDevice
member.summary:
Z Worktable position from device.
This property requests the current motor position from the Z motor device and translates it to worktable coordinates.

member.name: T:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDeviceCollection
member.summary: collection

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDeviceCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDeviceCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the SBaseYZDevice at the specified index in the collection.
member.returns: An SBaseYZDevice at each valid index.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SYZDeviceCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the SPosition at the specified index in the collection.
member.returns: The Y/Z device with the given name.

member.name: T:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice
member.summary:
Robot device.
The robot device is a collection of arms and a collection of other devices. In addition it has a reference to the CAN interface class.

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice._Flags
member.summary: Robot flag variable

member.name: F:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice._CanNet
member.summary: Name of the used CAN Net

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. This constructor creates a device with all configuration members to their default values.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: XML string configuration constructor. This constructor creates a device by parsing the device parameters from the given XML configuration string.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,Sias.BaseDev.SBaseArmDeviceCollection,Sias.BaseDev.SBaseDeviceCollection,Sias.Core.SPosition,Sias.Core.SPosition)
member.summary: Manual generation constructor. This constructor creates a device by using the given parameters.
member.param: Collection of connected no arm devices

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.ReadXMLString(System.Int32,System.Xml.XmlTextReader)
member.summary: Read object properties from XmlTextReader (XML configuration string).

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.GetArm(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the arm object at the given index.
member.returns: The requested arm device

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.StartConnect(System.String)
member.summary: Connect to Can Net. This function connects to the CAN net \a CanNet. To identify the application, it gives uses client name \a CName. A connection can only be established, if the CanIO.DLL has the same interface version with the same or a higher interface revision as the header files when compiling the CAN device driver. \n Call \ref Disconnect to disconnect again. \b Example: \code Ok = MyRobot.Connect("MyApp"); \endcode
member.returns: True if connection successfully, false if not.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.WaitUntilConnected
member.summary: Waits until connection is established (module requests finished).
member.returns: True if connection established successfully, false is not.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.Disconnect
member.summary: Robot disconnection. This method is used to disconnect from the robot.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary:
Init complete robot with all connected devices.
Initialization sequence: - Init all left orientated arms (home at left side) - Init all right orientated arms (home at right side) - Init all connected non arm devices .
member.param: This should allow init only parts, but is not supported yet. To keep applications compatible with older versions it is recommended to pass 0xFFFFFFFF for the init options. This forces an initialization of the complete arm.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.TraceThreadLocks(System.String)
member.summary: Trace device lock state of the device including all of its subdevices.
member.returns: true if the device or any of its sub devices is locked.

member.name: M:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.ReleaseThreadLocks(System.Boolean,System.String@)
member.summary:
Release thread locks
This method can be used on end of a thread to make sure all thread locks locked for the active thread are released.
member.param: true for releasing locked thread locks, false to keep them locked
Information string containing details on all locked thread locks
member.returns: true if any device of the robot or any execution group is locked.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.Flags
member.summary: Robot flag property

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.CanNet
member.summary: Name of the used CAN Net

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SRobotDevice.ExecutionGroup
member.summary:
Execution group property.
This property can be used to get/set the execution group of all sub devices of the Robot. Getting it results in a binary of all sub device execution groups.
IMPORTANT: Setting the execution group results in the same execution group for all sub devices. As this is in general not wanted the setting is protected.

Arm methods class
This class is the base class for all arm method blocks connected to SArmdevices or its derivates.

member.name: P:Sias.RobotDev.SArmMethods.Arm
member.summary:
Connected arm device property
This property defines the connected arm device. This Arm is used to move the arm device as well as to access the list of Y/Z devices.
